Key Match Events: Chris Boucher produced 13 points and six rebounds off the bench as the Raptors trounced the Washington Wizards 125-98 in their pre-season opener.
RJ Barrett led all scorers with 17 points on 7-of-10 shooting in 14 minutes before exiting the game with a bruised right shoulder.
Jordan Poole led Washington with 16 points and six assists.
The Raptors opened on a 13-2 run less than four minutes into the game.
Boucher’s dunk with 1:49 left helped the Raptors jump out to a 34-16 lead after the first quarter.
Boucher scored eight points in the third quarter, but the Wizards cut the Raptors lead to 15 with multiple baskets from Alexandre Sarr and Kyshawn George.
Toronto’s Jamison Battle scored eight points in the fourth quarter with two threes and a layup as the Raptors cruised to the resounding win.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Boucher expressed gratitude for the support from fans in Montreal, stating, 'The fans support us, they embrace us when we’re in town, and you can feel the love.'

Wizards coach Brian Keefe reflected on the game, saying, 'We didn’t love our start. Second quarter was much better, much better defensive mindset. The game got a little bit up and down in the third for both teams, but we were more competitive. But the start really hurt us. A lot to learn from this game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a sellout crowd of 21,900 at the Bell Centre in Montreal.
Vince Carter, who will become the first player in Raptors franchise history to have his number retired on Nov. 2, received the loudest ovation of the night.
